creator: mckyyy@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 26967
config file

This is similar to bug 48731, prefork ServerLimit stuck at 10.  I have that problem too.

I completely converted my web site to html from php to work around this problem, and now I can get 64 clients, using worker.c but no more.

I looked into the source a little.

It seems that the worker_pre_config in worker.c is erroneously setting
max clients to 10 for some reason having to do with whether
ThreadsPerChild has been set.

Then when set_max_clients runs, MaxClients is set to 64 instead of 3
times 64 where I want it to be.  This is causing my site to loose traffic.  I have been trying to resolve this problem since about the 20th of last month.

I have attached my httpd.conf

Thanks,

Marion McCoskey

Where's the error log, httpd -V,  and some sign this config file attached is use, and that your MaxClients isn't 192?

What's in conf.d/*.conf?
creator: covener@gmail.com
mckyyy@gmail.com
text:
There was a .conf file in conf.d that was causing the problem.  Thanks very much for pointing out that possibility to me.

Marion
